A

addAssociatedPart(Part) - Method in class Model.Product
This method adds the associated part that is passed in through part into the associatedParts array list.
addModifyAssociatedPart(ActionEvent) - Method in class Controller.ModifyProductController
This method adds the selected part from the top parts table into the bottom associated parts table.
It adds the parts added into the associatedPartsTable into the Inventory associatedParts array list using the addAssociatedPart method.
addPart(Part) - Static method in class Model.Inventory
This method adds the part passed in into the allParts array list.
AddPartController - Class in Controller
This is the AddPartController that handles the add part form.
It allows the user to select between the radio buttons of InHouse and Outsourced which will depict which subclass the part will go into.
The form has a save and cancel button.
The save button will add the part into the allParts list and the cancel button will return the user to the main form page.
AddPartController() - Constructor for class Controller.AddPartController
 
addProduct(Product) - Static method in class Model.Inventory
This method adds the new product passed in into the allProducts array list.
AddProductController - Class in Controller
This is the AddProductController class, and it controls all elements on the add product screen.
It allows the user to enter in data for a new product and to save this information by creating a new Product object.
This screen contains a topProduct table which contains all current available parts in the management system.
The user can select parts from this table and click the add button which will add that part to the associatedPartsTable below.
The user can select an associated part from the associatedPartsTable and click the remove associated part button to remove that part from the table.
The user can then press save button which will save that product to the allProducts array list in the Inventory class, as well as saving all the parts in the associatedPartsTable to the associatedParts array list in the product class.
If the user clicks cancel it will prompt the user that all data entered will be erased without saving and if ok is clicked, the user will be returned to the main form page.
AddProductController() - Constructor for class Controller.AddProductController
 
addTestData() - Static method in class Model.MainApplication
This method adds test data into the main form's part table which is called in the main method.
The method creates different objects of Outsourced parts, InHouse parts, and Products.
This method adds these objects to the allParts and allProducts array lists.
allParts - Static variable in class Model.Inventory
The array list that contains all current parts available in the Inventory Management System.
allProducts - Static variable in class Model.Inventory
The array list that contains all current products available in the Inventory Management System.
AssociatedInvCol - Variable in class Controller.ModifyProductController
 
AssociatedPartIDCol - Variable in class Controller.AddProductController
 
AssociatedPartIDCol - Variable in class Controller.ModifyProductController
 
AssociatedPartInvCol - Variable in class Controller.AddProductController
 
AssociatedPartNameCol - Variable in class Controller.AddProductController
 
AssociatedPartNameCol - Variable in class Controller.ModifyProductController
 
AssociatedPartPriceCostCol - Variable in class Controller.AddProductController
 
associatedParts - Variable in class Model.Product
This array list contains all current associated parts for each instance of a product.
associatedPartsTable - Variable in class Controller.AddProductController
 
AssociatedPriceCostCol - Variable in class Controller.ModifyProductController
